name: mifc
description: A minimum information standard checklist formalizing the description of food composition data and related metadata.
title: mifc

RecommendedSubset.name: RecommendedSubset
RecommendedSubset.description: A subset of the MIFC slots that are required and recommended for use use in a Food Composition Table/Database.
RecommendedSubset.title: recommended subset

string.name: string
notes: In RDF serializations, a slot with range of string is treated as a literal or type xsd:string.   If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "string".

integer.name: integer
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "integer".

boolean.name: boolean
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "boolean".

float.name: float
float.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:float specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "float".

double.name: double
double.description: A real number that conforms to the xsd:double specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "double".

decimal.name: decimal
decimal.description: A real number with arbitrary precision that conforms to the xsd:decimal specification
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "decimal".

time.name: time
time.description: A time object represents a (local) time of day, independent of any particular day
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners do not work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "time".

date.name: date
date.description: a date (year, month and day) in an idealized calendar
notes: URI is dateTime because OWL reasoners don't work with straight date or time
If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date".

datetime.name: datetime
datetime.description: The combination of a date and time
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "datetime".

date_or_datetime.name: date_or_datetime
date_or_datetime.description: Either a date or a datetime
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "date_or_datetime".

uriorcurie.name: uriorcurie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uriorcurie".

curie.name: curie
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "curie".
comments: in RDF serializations this MUST be expanded to a URI
in non-RDF serializations MAY be serialized as the compact representation

uri.name: uri
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "uri".
comments: in RDF serializations a slot with range of uri is treated as a literal or type xsd:anyURI unless it is an identifier or a reference to an identifier, in which case it is translated directly to a node

ncname.name: ncname
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "ncname".

objectidentifier.name: objectidentifier
objectidentifier.description: A URI or CURIE that represents an object in the model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "objectidentifier".
comments: Used for inheritance and type checking

nodeidentifier.name: nodeidentifier
nodeidentifier.description: A URI, CURIE or BNODE that represents a node in a model.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "nodeidentifier".

jsonpointer.name: jsonpointer
jsonpointer.description: A string encoding a JSON Pointer. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to a valid object within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpointer".

jsonpath.name: jsonpath
jsonpath.description: A string encoding a JSON Path. The value of the string MUST conform to JSON Point syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded in tree form.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "jsonpath".

sparqlpath.name: sparqlpath
sparqlpath.description: A string encoding a SPARQL Property Path. The value of the string MUST conform to SPARQL syntax and SHOULD dereference to zero or more valid objects within the current instance document when encoded as RDF.
notes: If you are authoring schemas in LinkML YAML, the type is referenced with the lower case "sparqlpath".

HPAEC-PAD.description: High-performance anion-exchange chromatography with pulsed amperometric detection

HPLC-MS/MS.description: High-performance liquid chromatography with tandem mass spectrometry

HPLC-UV.description: High-performance liquid chromatography with ultra-violet spectroscopy

ID-GC-MS.description: Isotope dilution gas chromatography mass spectrometry

LC-ESI-IDMS.description: Liquid chromatography with electrospray ionization-isotope dilution mass spectrometry

skos:exactMatch.description: Mappings assessed to indicate a high degree of confidence that the concepts expressed in the subject and object terms can be used interchangeably.
comments: From the sssom_schema: The subject and the object can, with a high degree of confidence, be used interchangeably across a wide range of information retrieval applications.
In SKOS this is described as following the transitive property.

skos:closeMatch.description: Mappings between the subject and object terms that convey a high degree of similarity, but are not exactly the same or interchangeable.
comments: From the sssom_schema: The subject and the object are sufficiently similar that they can be used interchangeably in some information retrieval applications.

skos:broadMatch.description: Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term is above the subject within a concept hierarchy.
comments: From the SKOS primer: A triple skos:broader (and skos:broadMatch) asserts that, the object of the triple, is a broader concept than , the subject of the triple.

skos:narrowMatch.description: Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term that is below the subject within a concept hierarchy.
comments: From the SKOS primer: A triple skos:narrower (and skos:narrowMatch) asserts that, the object of the triple, is a narrower concept than , the subject of the triple.

skos:relatedMatch.description: Mappings between subject and object terms that might have some association but are not clearly not referring to the the same or similar concepts.
comments: From the sssom_schema: The subject and the object are associated in some unspecified way.

CountryCode.name: CountryCode
comments: Source https://www.nationsonline.org/oneworld/country_code_list.htm

SGS.description: South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands

food_sample_id.name: food_sample_id
food_sample_id.description: A string denoting the primary identifier for a sample of the class Food. Note that food_sample_id should be unique in a given dataset and should be used to relate Food and Component records via component_sample_id from the Component class.
comments: Instead of `identifier: true` perhaps we can use unique_keys https://linkml.io/linkml/schemas/constraints.html

food_description_label.name: food_description_label
food_description_label.description: A string clearly and unambiguous describing the sampled primary food material, in accordance with globally accepted guidelines for the description of foods.
comments: For reference see book by Greenfield and Southgate 'Food Composition Data: Production Management and Use' ISBN-10 9251049491 and cited literature

food_primary_type.name: food_primary_type
food_primary_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the primary food material which was sampled.
comments: The food_primary_type could be sourced from one of various food vocabularies such as USDA's FDC vocabulary, FoodEx2, LanguaL, or FoodOn.

food_description_match_type.name: food_description_match_type
food_description_match_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the type of mapping between the food_description_label and food_primary_type_label.
comments: Note that the subject is the food_description_label and the object is food_primary_type_label
See https://github.com/mapping-commons/sssom/blob/master/src/sssom_schema/schema/sssom_schema.yaml

examples.description: Mappings assessed to indicate a high degree of confidence that the concepts expressed in the subject and object terms can be used interchangeably. In SKOS this is described as following the transitive property.
Mappings between the subject and object terms that convey a high degree of similarity, but are not exactly the same or interchangeable.
Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term is above the subject within a concept hierarchy.
Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term that is below the subject within a concept hierarchy.
Mappings between subject and object terms that might have some association but are not clearly not referring to the the same or similar concepts.

food_primary_type_label.name: food_primary_type_label
food_primary_type_label.description: A string denoting the label of a controlled vocabulary term representing the primary food material which was sampled.
comments: This field is to be used only for the string labels of from controlled vocabulary terms which are mapped to the food_description_label.

food_primary_type_scientific_name.name: food_primary_type_scientific_name
food_primary_type_scientific_name.description: A string denoting the scientific name, (in binomial nomenclature) of an organism that a food material is primarily composed of.
comments: This slot should only be used in cases where food materials are single ingredient foods or have a limited number of additives e.g. "salted Nori seaweed" or "filleted anchovies canned in oil".

food_primary_type_icncp_group_name.name: food_primary_type_icncp_group_name
food_primary_type_icncp_group_name.description: A string denoting the Group (or cultivar-group) formal taxon category of the primary food material as specified by the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants (ICNCP).
comments: This slot requires discussion as it alternatively be included as part of the food_primary_type_scientific_name slot.

food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name.name: food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name
food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name.description: A string denoting the cultivar name of the primary food material as specified by the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants (ICNCP).
comments: The ICNCP only applies to algae, fungi, and plant species. If present this slot should be used in addition to the food_primary_type_icncp_group_name slot.

food_primary_type_animal_breed_name.name: food_primary_type_animal_breed_name
food_primary_type_animal_breed_name.description: A string denoting the breed name of the primary food material.
comments: This slot should only be used in cases where food material is an animal with a recognizable breed name that is managed by a national breed registry, breed association, or similar organization. E.g., "Wagyu" for the Wagu cattle breed.

food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id.name: food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id
food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id.description: A curie from the ontology representation of the NCBI organismal taxonomy (NCBITaxon) describing the taxonomic identifier of the primary food material.
comments: To do specify an NCBITaxon curie as the range for the slot.

food_upc_code.name: food_upc_code
food_upc_code.description: An string denoting a Universal Product Code (UPC) barcode of a food sample.

food_preservation_state.name: food_preservation_state
food_preservation_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the preservation state(s) of a food sample (e.g., "raw").

food_storage_temperature_state.name: food_storage_temperature_state
food_storage_temperature_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the qualitative temperature state at which a food sample was stored prior to acquisition (e.g., "Refrigerated").

food_ripeness_state.name: food_ripeness_state
food_ripeness_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the qualitative freshness state of a food sample when prepared for analysis.

food_cooking_method.name: food_cooking_method
food_cooking_method.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the any cooking method(s) applied to a food sample prior to analysis (e.g., "baked").

food_origin_country.name: food_origin_country
food_origin_country.description: A string denoting the country code from which a food sample originates.

food_acquisition_city.name: food_acquisition_city
food_acquisition_city.description: A string denoting the city in which a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_country.name: food_acquisition_country
food_acquisition_country.description: A string denoting the country code from which a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_country_subdivision.name: food_acquisition_country_subdivision
food_acquisition_country_subdivision.description: A string denoting the country subdivision from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., state or province).

food_acquisition_date.name: food_acquisition_date
food_acquisition_date.description: A date value representing the date a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_location_type.name: food_acquisition_location_type
food_acquisition_location_type.description: A string describing the type of location from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., a supermarket).

food_acquisition_location_name.name: food_acquisition_location_name
food_acquisition_location_name.description: A string describing the name of the location from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., "Safeway").

food_acquisition_latitude.name: food_acquisition_latitude
food_acquisition_latitude.description: A float representing the latitude of the place from which the food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_longitude.name: food_acquisition_longitude
food_acquisition_longitude.description: A float representing the longitude of the place from which the food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_agent_name.name: food_acquisition_agent_name
food_acquisition_agent_name.description: A string denoting the name of the agent (person, device or other type of service) that acquired the food sample.

food_acquisition_organization.name: food_acquisition_organization
food_acquisition_organization.description: A string denoting the name of the organization responsible for acquired the food sample.

food_distributor_city.name: food_distributor_city
food_distributor_city.description: A string denoting the city of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired.

food_distributor_country.name: food_distributor_country
food_distributor_country.description: A string denoting the country code of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired.

food_distributor_country_subdivision.name: food_distributor_country_subdivision
food_distributor_country_subdivision.description: A string denoting the country subdivision of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired, (e.g., state or province).
comments: To be determined if state codes should be specified over full names of states/provinces for countries globally.

food_expiration_date.name: food_expiration_date
food_expiration_date.description: A date value representing the food expiration data as shown on the labeling information of the food sample.

food_sell_by_date.name: food_sell_by_date
food_sell_by_date.description: A date value representing a date that indicates to stores how long to display a food product for sale for inventory management purposes.
comments: Definition sourced from https://www.fsis.usda.gov/food-safety/safe-food-handling-and-preparation/food-safety-basics/food-product-dating.

food_category_label.name: food_category_label
food_category_label.description: A string or controlled vocabulary denoting the label of the food group or category of the primary food material.

food_additional_types.name: food_additional_types
food_additional_types.description: A list of controlled vocabulary denoting the label(s) of additional food types, not including the food_primary_type that are in a food sample.

food_brand_name.name: food_brand_name
food_brand_name.description: A string denoting a name identifying a product, service, or organization selling and or distributing the primary food material.

food_lot_number.name: food_lot_number
food_lot_number.description: A string denoting the identifying lot number number assigned by a manufacturer to a particular quantity, (or lot) of the sampled primary food material.
comments: A lot number can also be referred to as lot code.

food_label_weight.name: food_label_weight
food_label_weight.description: A float denoting the mass, (or weight on earth) as specified on the product label of a sampled primary food material.
comments: This field should be used in along with food_acquisition_label_weight_unit to express the units the food_label_weight was measured.

food_label_weight_unit.name: food_label_weight_unit
food_label_weight_unit.description: A unit code representing the unit of measurement in which a food_label_weight is measured.

component_sample_id.name: component_sample_id
component_sample_id.description: A string denoting the primary identifier for a sample of the class Component.
comments: Note that component_sample_id does not need be unique in a given dataset and should be used to relate Food and Component records via food_sample_id from the Food class.

component_type.name: component_type
component_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the type of component of nutritional interest analyzed from a food sample.

component_type_label.name: component_type_label
component_type_label.description: A string denoting the label of a controlled vocabulary term representing an analyzed component_type from a food sample.

component_recorded_value.name: component_recorded_value
component_recorded_value.description: A float representing a recorded value of a component of nutritional interest measured from a laboratory sample derived from a food sample.

component_measurement_unit.name: component_measurement_unit
component_measurement_unit.description: A unit code representing the unit of measurement in which a component_recorded_value is measured.
comments: TODO find a way to constrain these with valid UCUM codes perhaps enum or recommended LINKML units docs.

component_data_points_number.name: component_data_points_number
component_data_points_number.description: An integer representing the number of individual samples that comprise a component sample. 1 if an individual sample >1 if an aggregation of samples.

component_record_date.name: component_record_date
component_record_date.description: A date value representing recorded date pertaining to an analyzed sample.
comments: Allows for ambiguity of date record relative to component_analysis_date. Use this if a date for a record is know but it is unclear if it is specifically the date of analysis.

component_analysis_organization.name: component_analysis_organization
component_analysis_organization.description: One or more string value(s) representing the name(s) of any organization(s) involved in the analysis of a component of nutritional interest from a food sample.

component_analysis_date.name: component_analysis_date
component_analysis_date.description: A date value representing the date in which a component of nutritional interest was analyzed.
comments: Use this field if the exact date of analysis is known if there is date ambiguity use component_record_date.

component_comment.name: component_comment
component_comment.description: A comment relating to an analyzed component of nutritional interest.

component_derivation_type.name: component_derivation_type
component_derivation_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term denoting how a component of nutritional interest was generated, (e.g., Analytical or Calculated).

component_limit_of_quantitation.name: component_limit_of_quantitation
component_limit_of_quantitation.description: A string representing the lowest analyte concentration likely to be reliably distinguished from the Limit of Blank (LoB) and at which detection is feasible during the analysis of a component of nutritional interest.
comments: LoB, (used in the description) is the highest apparent analyte concentration expected to be found when replicates of a blank sample containing no analyte are tested. Description reference from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2556583/.

compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_valu.name: compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_value
compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_valu.description: A float representing the minimum measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_valu.name: compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_value
compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_valu.description: A float representing the maximum measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_median_value.name: compound_sample_aggregation_median_value
compound_sample_aggregation_median_value.description: A float representing the median measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_standard_dev.name: compound_sample_aggregation_standard_deviation
compound_sample_aggregation_standard_dev.description: A float representing the standard deviation of a measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_analytical_measurement_protocol.name: compound_analytical_measurement_protocol_doi
compound_analytical_measurement_protocol.description: A string denoting a digital object identifier link to a measurement protocol used to conduct an analytical analysis on a sample.

compound_analytical_measurement_method.name: compound_analytical_measurement_method
compound_analytical_measurement_method.description: A controlled vocabulary term denoting the method used to conduct an analytical analysis on a sample.

compound_analytical_laboratory_name.name: compound_analytical_laboratory_name
compound_analytical_laboratory_name.description: A string denoting the name of a laboratory that conducted the analytical analysis of a component of nutritional interest.

component_quality_control_remeasurement.name: component_quality_control_remeasurement
component_quality_control_remeasurement.description: A boolean value denoting TRUE if a component_recorded_value was measured more than once for internal laboratory quality control purposes.
comments: This could be alternatively be modeled with an integer rather than a boolean.

provenance_dataset_label.name: provenance_dataset_label
provenance_dataset_label.description: A string corresponding to the labeled name of dataset (e.g., "Standard Reference (SR) Legacy").

provenance_mifc_version_tag.name: provenance_mifc_version_tag
provenance_mifc_version_tag.description: A string corresponding to a named MIFC release number (e.g., "v1.0.1").

provenance_contributor_orcid.name: provenance_contributor_orcid
provenance_contributor_orcid.description: A string corresponding to a "|" delimited list of ORCIDs of people who contributed to a MIFC formatted dataset. See https://orcid.org/.

provenance_organization_name.name: provenance_organization_name
provenance_organization_name.description: A string corresponding to a "|" delimited list of organizations who created or help to create to a MIFC formatted dataset. E.g., "USDA".

food_laboratory_sample_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_id
food_laboratory_sample_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if a separate ID is assigned to laboratory samples derived from food samples. Otherwise just use the food_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id
food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a unique aliquot of a food laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if identifiers are assigned to aliquots/sub-samples of food laboratory samples denoted by their food_laboratory_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_batch_id
food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a batch of laboratory samples analysed together.

Food.name: Food
Food.description: Metadata about foods analyzed for components of nutritional interest.

food_sample_id.name: food_sample_id
food_sample_id.description: A string denoting the primary identifier for a sample of the class Food. Note that food_sample_id should be unique in a given dataset and should be used to relate Food and Component records via component_sample_id from the Component class.
comments: Instead of `identifier: true` perhaps we can use unique_keys https://linkml.io/linkml/schemas/constraints.html

food_description_label.name: food_description_label
food_description_label.description: A string clearly and unambiguous describing the sampled primary food material, in accordance with globally accepted guidelines for the description of foods.
comments: For reference see book by Greenfield and Southgate 'Food Composition Data: Production Management and Use' ISBN-10 9251049491 and cited literature

food_primary_type.name: food_primary_type
food_primary_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the primary food material which was sampled.
comments: The food_primary_type could be sourced from one of various food vocabularies such as USDA's FDC vocabulary, FoodEx2, LanguaL, or FoodOn.

food_primary_type_label.name: food_primary_type_label
food_primary_type_label.description: A string denoting the label of a controlled vocabulary term representing the primary food material which was sampled.
comments: This field is to be used only for the string labels of from controlled vocabulary terms which are mapped to the food_description_label.

food_primary_type_scientific_name.name: food_primary_type_scientific_name
food_primary_type_scientific_name.description: A string denoting the scientific name, (in binomial nomenclature) of an organism that a food material is primarily composed of.
comments: This slot should only be used in cases where food materials are single ingredient foods or have a limited number of additives e.g. "salted Nori seaweed" or "filleted anchovies canned in oil".

food_primary_type_icncp_group_name.name: food_primary_type_icncp_group_name
food_primary_type_icncp_group_name.description: A string denoting the Group (or cultivar-group) formal taxon category of the primary food material as specified by the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants (ICNCP).
comments: This slot requires discussion as it alternatively be included as part of the food_primary_type_scientific_name slot.

food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name.name: food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name
food_primary_type_icncp_cultivar_name.description: A string denoting the cultivar name of the primary food material as specified by the International Code of Nomenclature for Cultivated Plants (ICNCP).
comments: The ICNCP only applies to algae, fungi, and plant species. If present this slot should be used in addition to the food_primary_type_icncp_group_name slot.

food_primary_type_animal_breed_name.name: food_primary_type_animal_breed_name
food_primary_type_animal_breed_name.description: A string denoting the breed name of the primary food material.
comments: This slot should only be used in cases where food material is an animal with a recognizable breed name that is managed by a national breed registry, breed association, or similar organization. E.g., "Wagyu" for the Wagu cattle breed.

food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id.name: food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id
food_primary_type_ncbi_taxon_id.description: A curie from the ontology representation of the NCBI organismal taxonomy (NCBITaxon) describing the taxonomic identifier of the primary food material.
comments: To do specify an NCBITaxon curie as the range for the slot.

food_description_match_type.name: food_description_match_type
food_description_match_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the type of mapping between the food_description_label and food_primary_type_label.
comments: Note that the subject is the food_description_label and the object is food_primary_type_label
See https://github.com/mapping-commons/sssom/blob/master/src/sssom_schema/schema/sssom_schema.yaml

examples.description: Mappings assessed to indicate a high degree of confidence that the concepts expressed in the subject and object terms can be used interchangeably. In SKOS this is described as following the transitive property.
Mappings between the subject and object terms that convey a high degree of similarity, but are not exactly the same or interchangeable.
Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term is above the subject within a concept hierarchy.
Mappings between a subject and object terms, where the object term that is below the subject within a concept hierarchy.
Mappings between subject and object terms that might have some association but are not clearly not referring to the the same or similar concepts.

food_upc_code.name: food_upc_code
food_upc_code.description: An string denoting a Universal Product Code (UPC) barcode of a food sample.

food_preservation_state.name: food_preservation_state
food_preservation_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the preservation state(s) of a food sample (e.g., "raw").

food_storage_temperature_state.name: food_storage_temperature_state
food_storage_temperature_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the qualitative temperature state at which a food sample was stored prior to acquisition (e.g., "Refrigerated").

food_ripeness_state.name: food_ripeness_state
food_ripeness_state.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the qualitative freshness state of a food sample when prepared for analysis.

food_cooking_method.name: food_cooking_method
food_cooking_method.description: An enumerated set of controlled vocabulary terms representing the any cooking method(s) applied to a food sample prior to analysis (e.g., "baked").

food_origin_country.name: food_origin_country
food_origin_country.description: A string denoting the country code from which a food sample originates.

food_acquisition_city.name: food_acquisition_city
food_acquisition_city.description: A string denoting the city in which a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_country.name: food_acquisition_country
food_acquisition_country.description: A string denoting the country code from which a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_country_subdivision.name: food_acquisition_country_subdivision
food_acquisition_country_subdivision.description: A string denoting the country subdivision from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., state or province).

food_acquisition_date.name: food_acquisition_date
food_acquisition_date.description: A date value representing the date a food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_location_type.name: food_acquisition_location_type
food_acquisition_location_type.description: A string describing the type of location from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., a supermarket).

food_acquisition_location_name.name: food_acquisition_location_name
food_acquisition_location_name.description: A string describing the name of the location from which a food sample was acquired (e.g., "Safeway").

food_acquisition_latitude.name: food_acquisition_latitude
food_acquisition_latitude.description: A float representing the latitude of the place from which the food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_longitude.name: food_acquisition_longitude
food_acquisition_longitude.description: A float representing the longitude of the place from which the food sample was acquired.

food_acquisition_agent_name.name: food_acquisition_agent_name
food_acquisition_agent_name.description: A string denoting the name of the agent (person, device or other type of service) that acquired the food sample.

food_acquisition_organization.name: food_acquisition_organization
food_acquisition_organization.description: A string denoting the name of the organization responsible for acquired the food sample.

food_distributor_city.name: food_distributor_city
food_distributor_city.description: A string denoting the city of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired.

food_distributor_country.name: food_distributor_country
food_distributor_country.description: A string denoting the country code of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired.

food_distributor_country_subdivision.name: food_distributor_country_subdivision
food_distributor_country_subdivision.description: A string denoting the country subdivision of a distributor organization from which a food sample was acquired, (e.g., state or province).
comments: To be determined if state codes should be specified over full names of states/provinces for countries globally.

food_expiration_date.name: food_expiration_date
food_expiration_date.description: A date value representing the food expiration data as shown on the labeling information of the food sample.

food_sell_by_date.name: food_sell_by_date
food_sell_by_date.description: A date value representing a date that indicates to stores how long to display a food product for sale for inventory management purposes.
comments: Definition sourced from https://www.fsis.usda.gov/food-safety/safe-food-handling-and-preparation/food-safety-basics/food-product-dating.

food_category_label.name: food_category_label
food_category_label.description: A string or controlled vocabulary denoting the label of the food group or category of the primary food material.

food_additional_types.name: food_additional_types
food_additional_types.description: A list of controlled vocabulary denoting the label(s) of additional food types, not including the food_primary_type that are in a food sample.

food_laboratory_sample_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_id
food_laboratory_sample_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if a separate ID is assigned to laboratory samples derived from food samples. Otherwise just use the food_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id
food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a unique aliquot of a food laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if identifiers are assigned to aliquots/sub-samples of food laboratory samples denoted by their food_laboratory_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_batch_id
food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a batch of laboratory samples analysed together.

food_brand_name.name: food_brand_name
food_brand_name.description: A string denoting a name identifying a product, service, or organization selling and or distributing the primary food material.

food_lot_number.name: food_lot_number
food_lot_number.description: A string denoting the identifying lot number number assigned by a manufacturer to a particular quantity, (or lot) of the sampled primary food material.
comments: A lot number can also be referred to as lot code.

food_label_weight.name: food_label_weight
food_label_weight.description: A float denoting the mass, (or weight on earth) as specified on the product label of a sampled primary food material.
comments: This field should be used in along with food_acquisition_label_weight_unit to express the units the food_label_weight was measured.

food_label_weight_unit.name: food_label_weight_unit
food_label_weight_unit.description: A unit code representing the unit of measurement in which a food_label_weight is measured.

Component.name: Component
Component.description: Metadata about components of nutritional interest measured from foods.

component_sample_id.name: component_sample_id
component_sample_id.description: A string denoting the primary identifier for a sample of the class Component.
comments: Note that component_sample_id does not need be unique in a given dataset and should be used to relate Food and Component records via food_sample_id from the Food class.

component_type.name: component_type
component_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term representing the type of component of nutritional interest analyzed from a food sample.

component_type_label.name: component_type_label
component_type_label.description: A string denoting the label of a controlled vocabulary term representing an analyzed component_type from a food sample.

component_recorded_value.name: component_recorded_value
component_recorded_value.description: A float representing a recorded value of a component of nutritional interest measured from a laboratory sample derived from a food sample.

component_measurement_unit.name: component_measurement_unit
component_measurement_unit.description: A unit code representing the unit of measurement in which a component_recorded_value is measured.
comments: TODO find a way to constrain these with valid UCUM codes perhaps enum or recommended LINKML units docs.

component_data_points_number.name: component_data_points_number
component_data_points_number.description: An integer representing the number of individual samples that comprise a component sample. 1 if an individual sample >1 if an aggregation of samples.

component_record_date.name: component_record_date
component_record_date.description: A date value representing recorded date pertaining to an analyzed sample.
comments: Allows for ambiguity of date record relative to component_analysis_date. Use this if a date for a record is know but it is unclear if it is specifically the date of analysis.

component_analysis_date.name: component_analysis_date
component_analysis_date.description: A date value representing the date in which a component of nutritional interest was analyzed.
comments: Use this field if the exact date of analysis is known if there is date ambiguity use component_record_date.

component_analysis_organization.name: component_analysis_organization
component_analysis_organization.description: One or more string value(s) representing the name(s) of any organization(s) involved in the analysis of a component of nutritional interest from a food sample.

component_comment.name: component_comment
component_comment.description: A comment relating to an analyzed component of nutritional interest.

component_derivation_type.name: component_derivation_type
component_derivation_type.description: A controlled vocabulary term denoting how a component of nutritional interest was generated, (e.g., Analytical or Calculated).

component_limit_of_quantitation.name: component_limit_of_quantitation
component_limit_of_quantitation.description: A string representing the lowest analyte concentration likely to be reliably distinguished from the Limit of Blank (LoB) and at which detection is feasible during the analysis of a component of nutritional interest.
comments: LoB, (used in the description) is the highest apparent analyte concentration expected to be found when replicates of a blank sample containing no analyte are tested. Description reference from https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2556583/.

compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_valu.name: compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_value
compound_sample_aggregation_minimum_valu.description: A float representing the minimum measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_valu.name: compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_value
compound_sample_aggregation_maximum_valu.description: A float representing the maximum measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_median_value.name: compound_sample_aggregation_median_value
compound_sample_aggregation_median_value.description: A float representing the median measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_sample_aggregation_standard_dev.name: compound_sample_aggregation_standard_deviation
compound_sample_aggregation_standard_dev.description: A float representing the standard deviation of a measured compound value of an aggregation of compound samples.

compound_analytical_measurement_protocol.name: compound_analytical_measurement_protocol_doi
compound_analytical_measurement_protocol.description: A string denoting a digital object identifier link to a measurement protocol used to conduct an analytical analysis on a sample.

compound_analytical_measurement_method.name: compound_analytical_measurement_method
compound_analytical_measurement_method.description: A controlled vocabulary term denoting the method used to conduct an analytical analysis on a sample.

compound_analytical_laboratory_name.name: compound_analytical_laboratory_name
compound_analytical_laboratory_name.description: A string denoting the name of a laboratory that conducted the analytical analysis of a component of nutritional interest.

component_quality_control_remeasurement.name: component_quality_control_remeasurement
component_quality_control_remeasurement.description: A boolean value denoting TRUE if a component_recorded_value was measured more than once for internal laboratory quality control purposes.
comments: This could be alternatively be modeled with an integer rather than a boolean.

food_laboratory_sample_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_id
food_laboratory_sample_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if a separate ID is assigned to laboratory samples derived from food samples. Otherwise just use the food_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id
food_laboratory_sample_aliquot_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a unique aliquot of a food laboratory sample which was prepared from a food sample.
comments: Only use this attribute if identifiers are assigned to aliquots/sub-samples of food laboratory samples denoted by their food_laboratory_sample_id.

food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.name: food_laboratory_sample_batch_id
food_laboratory_sample_batch_id.description: A string denoting an identifier of a batch of laboratory samples analysed together.

Provenance.name: Provenance
Provenance.description: Supplemental data about the provenance of a Food and Component dataset collection standardized using MIFC.

provenance_dataset_label.name: provenance_dataset_label
provenance_dataset_label.description: A string corresponding to the labeled name of dataset (e.g., "Standard Reference (SR) Legacy").

provenance_mifc_version_tag.name: provenance_mifc_version_tag
provenance_mifc_version_tag.description: A string corresponding to a named MIFC release number (e.g., "v1.0.1").

provenance_contributor_orcid.name: provenance_contributor_orcid
provenance_contributor_orcid.description: A string corresponding to a "|" delimited list of ORCIDs of people who contributed to a MIFC formatted dataset. See https://orcid.org/.

provenance_organization_name.name: provenance_organization_name
provenance_organization_name.description: A string corresponding to a "|" delimited list of organizations who created or help to create to a MIFC formatted dataset. E.g., "USDA".
